attributes.action: All Public building disabled toilets are fitted with Emergency Red Cord Alarms.
attributes.additional_details:
Along with my Wife we visited the Teviot Smokery  Water Gardens   Coffee and Gift shop. When wishing to use the toilets I could not negotiate my walker into the toilet having to leave it outside.
When in the toilet cubical I noticed there was no Emergency Red Cord Alarm which left me feeling isolated and afraid that if I stumbled and fell I could not summon help.
I reported my concerns to the staff and it was placed in the shop log/diary for the attention of the General Manager.
attributes.background: After enquiring to the Scottish Borders Council Planning and Regulatory Services I was informed that it was only compulsory to fit these potential life saving Emergency Red Cord Alarms in new Buildings and only when it is "practicable" in older buildings.
